subject: Re: [junit] ErrorCollector Question
msgSnippet: Law, You might want to use your own subclass of ErrorCollector: public class DumpingErrorCollector extends ErrorCollector { @Override protected void verify()
messageBody:
Law,

You might want to use your own subclass of ErrorCollector:

public class DumpingErrorCollector extends ErrorCollector {
@Override protected void verify() throws Throwable {
try {
super.verify();
} catch (Throwable t) {
dump(t);
throw t;
}
}
}

Will that work?

David Saff


On Fri, Aug 5, 2011 at 11:19 AM, Law <lawcab@...> wrote:
> Good Day.
>
> We are starting to use ErrorCollector with our Selenium test. What I wanted to do next was to dump the exception that the test is out putting at the end of the test to the db. I believe this is comming from the errorcollector. How can I get that?
>
> Thanks,
> Law
